making the 2011 Dodge Grand Caravan and Chrysler Town and Country this week. "We need to completely rethink the minivan," CEO Sergio Marchionne said Tuesday at the Canadian plant where Chrysler's minivans are made. We need to retain all its functionality but make it much more versatile. Sergio Marchionne said that could mean new products that can still carry a lot of people but won't look like traditional minivans. workers vote against the deal. Vote-casting at the factory, which employs around 5,500 people, began on Thursday evening and ended Friday around 1830 GMT. Voting turnout was put at 96 percent. The voting slips that have been slipped into the factory's ballot boxes since yesterday are destined to change the country's industrial history, Silvio Berlusconi Sole 24 Ore business paper said in an editorial on Friday. Page Six reports that outgoing Google CEO Eric Schmidt is in talks with "Parker Spitzer" executive producer Liza McGuirk on a new show that he would host. The two first connected on the Sunday foreign-affairs program " Fareed Zakaria GPS, which Liza McGuirk executive produced and where Eric Schmidt was a regular guest. When Eric Schmidt filmed a pilot for CNN in August, Liza McGuirk oversaw the production."
